page.title: 19STOUR WOOD BY LIAN MEACHEN
page.content: STOUR WOOD IS THE ONLY WOODLAND IN OUR SURVEY AREA.WE WENT TO STOUR WOOD ON MAY 3.STOUR WOOD IS ABOUT 130 ACRES.IT IS OWNED BY THE WOODLAND TRUST.THE WARDEN IS MR LEVETT.IT IS MAINLY A DECIDUIOUS WOOD.WE SAW ONE DOUGLAS FIR AND SOME HOLLY THAT ARE EVERGREEN.HERE IS A LIST OF DECIDUIOUS TREES WE SAW:HAZEL,WILLOW,ASH,MAPLE,ASPEN,ELM, ELDER,SWEET AND HORSE CHESTNUT,OAK, SILVER BIRCH,SERVICE TREE,WILD CHERRY, BLACKTHORN,HAWTHORN.THERE WERE VERY FEW SPECIES OF BIRDS BECAUSE THERE WERE TOO MANY GREY SQUIRRELS,RATS AND FOXES.ANY WOOD THAT IS CUT NOWADAYS IS SOLD MAINLY FOR FIREWOOD.THESE ARE SOME PLANTS AND WILD FLOWERS WE SAW GROWING:IVY,WILD ARUM,VIOLETS,HONEY- SUCKLE,DOCK,CELANDINES AND WOOD ANENOMES.THE MAJORITY OF TREES ARE SWEET CHESTNUTS;THE ROMANS PLANTED THE WOOD 2000 YEARS AGO.
